title: Molasses Bread
ingredients: 5tablespoons lightly salted butter, plus extra to serve
directions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350°F. Grease and line a small 6 1/2-x 3 3/4-inch loaf pan.
2. Sift the flour, baking soda, and spices into a bowl. Lightly rub in the butter until the mixture resembles fine crumbs.

3. Whisk the molasses with the eggs and buttermilk, then stir in the sugar. Make a well in the center of the flour mixture and pour in the molasses mixture. Mix with a fork, gradually drawing in the flour from around the edges.
4. Add the currants and golden raisins, and mix to a soft dough. Spoon the dough into the prepared loaf pan, leveling the surface with a wet spatula.
5. Bake in the preheated oven for 45–55 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
6. Let cool in the pan for 15 minutes, then invert onto a wire rack and let rest for about 2 hours to cool completely.
